content.description: Lots of crimps and and pinches for the designed route, but there are also lots of good holds around it to catch yourself if you are about to fall. The crux is moving your foot to the toe hook position while grabbing the right side crimp.
content.protection: It is on the water so there's not much room, but I only used one large pad (Petzel Cirro).
content.location: There are two side facing crimps that face each other which make it pretty recognizable.

content.description: Not a very large area, but it is very easy to get to and can be used for a good warmup. There is a good view of the falls, and is somewhat secluded. It is also fairly clean compared to the other areas of Lime-Kiln Park (it isn't very chossy). It is also shaded for most of the day (except around noon).
